title: Furnace

properties.name: description
properties.value: A furnace is an interactive scenery object primarily used in Smithing to smelt various ores into metal bars. Furnaces around Gielinor are identified with a furnace  icon on the world map and minimap.

content:
The RuneScape Wiki also has an article on: rsw:FurnaceThe RuneScape Classic Wiki also has an article on: classicrsw:Furnace
"Forge" redirects here. For the forge in the Ruins of Camdozaal, see Sacred Forge.
Furnace
Released4 January 2001 (Update)
MembersSome
QuestNo
LocationVaries
OptionsSmelt
ExamineVaries
Advanced data
Object ID2030, 3294, 4304, 6189, 6190, 10082, 11009, 11010, 12100, 12809, 16469, 16657, 21879, 22721, 24009, 26300, 28565, 30157, 30158

A furnace is an interactive scenery object primarily used in Smithing to smelt various ores into metal bars. Furnaces around Gielinor are identified with a furnace icon on the world map and minimap.

Furnaces are also used for Crafting from metal bars. With the appropriate mould in their inventory and the required Crafting level, players can use the furnace to craft gold or silver bars into jewellery such as rings or holy symbols, assuming they have the appropriate mould in their inventory and the required Crafting level. Players may also make molten glass by smelting soda ash and a bucket of sand.

Due to a furnace's distance from a bank, players with level 43 Magic may choose to use Superheat Item instead of furnaces for smelting bars, earning both Magic and Smithing experience, at a higher overall cost.

The closest furnace to a bank is located in Prifddinas (requiring Song of the Elves), closely followed by the furnace in Edgeville. If you are a new player with limited teleport options and need to make use of a furnace just once, you can teleport to Lumbridge and use the furnace slightly north of the teleport area.

Contents

  • 1 Locations
  • 2 Changes
  • 3 Trivia
  • 4 See also

Locations[edit | edit source]

Furnace location Distance from bank Members Notes
Edgeville 15 (4.8 seconds) 0
 The closest furnace to a bank in free-to-play. Members who wear Varrock armour have a chance of smelting 2 bars at once at this furnace.
Al-Kharid 30 (9 seconds) 0
 Located directly north of the bank. It was the closest furnace in free-to-play until the Edgeville furnace was made available in free worlds.
Falador 39 (12 seconds) 0
 Located immediately south-east of Falador square. Closer to the west bank than the east one.
Lumbridge 85 (2nd floor[UK]3rd floor[US] - 25.8 seconds)
93 (Culinaromancer's Chest - 28.2 seconds) 		0
 Located north of Lumbridge Castle.
Wilderness, Level 28 116 squares from the Ferox Enclave bank (34.8 seconds) 0
 Located in the Wilderness at level 28. Useful for the nearby mines, but risky due to PKers.
Prifddinas 11 (3.6 seconds) 1
 Currently the closest furnace to both an anvil and a bank. Requires completion of Song of the Elves.
Shilo Village 10 (3 seconds) 1
 Requires completion of Shilo Village. The closest furnace to a bank for those who haven't completed Song of the Elves. Players must pay 20 coins each time, unless they have Karamja gloves 4.
Neitiznot 15 (4.8 seconds) 1
 Due to being positioned where you don't have to move your camera when smelting or banking, this furnace is commonly used by OSRS Mobile players.
Mount Karuulm 15 (4.8 seconds) 1
 Can be quickly accessed using the teleport option on Rada's blessing 3 or by fairy ring (code CIR).
Dorgesh-Kaan 99 (30 seconds) 1
 Can only be used to smelt jewellery and glass.
Port Phasmatys 17 (5.4 seconds) 1
 Equipping a ghostspeak amulet or Morytania legs 2 or higher allows you to skip the bank dialogue.
Elemental workshop 52 (15.6 seconds) 1
 Can only be used to smelt Elemental ore. A Battered key is required to enter.
Piscatoris 22 (6.6 seconds) 1
 Requires completion of Swan Song.
Mor Ul Rek 25 (7.8 seconds) 1
 In-game, these are labeled as, Lava forges, and can be found in both the inner and outer areas.
Burgh de Rott 31 (9.6 seconds) 1
 There are no significant mining areas nearby.
Lovakengj 37 (11.4 seconds) 1
 Located directly between the Lovakengj bank and mine.
Zanaris 52 (16.2 seconds) 1
 Requires completion of Lost City.
East Ardougne 41 (12.6 seconds) 1
 Closest to the north Ardougne bank.
Keldagrim 18 squares from bank to conveyor belt (5.4 seconds), 8 from bank to bar dispenser (2.4 seconds). 1
 The Giant Dwarf quest is needed to have been started or completed to enter the city. The furnace is used as part of the Blast Furnace minigame. 2500 coins are needed to use it if you are not 60 Smithing.
Wilderness Resource Area 93 squares from Edgeville (28.2 seconds)

109 squares from the Mage Arena bank (33 seconds)

1
 Banking in Edgeville or at the Mage Arena using the Wilderness lever requires a knife or slash weapon, as well as coins to re-enter. Piles in the area can turn items to banknotes for a fee.
Darkmeyer 140 (42 seconds) 1
 Requires Sins of the Father to access and Vyre noble clothing to use safely.
Forsaken Tower 177 (53.4 seconds) 1
 No significant mining areas nearby. The Lovakengj furnace mentioned above is much better to use for training.
Entrana 95 (28.8 seconds - 38.4 if not using the Draynor wall shortcut). 1
 This furnace is mainly used in Crafting to make glass, as all materials are found on the island.
Rellekka 96 squares from Lunar Isle bank (28.8 seconds) 1
 Usable after The Fremennik Trials. Prior to the release of Song of the Elves, this was the closest furnace to an anvil.
Enakhra's Temple 241 from Nardah bank (72.6 seconds) 1
 Very far from a bank, but sometimes used for smelting gold from the nearby mine south-west of Nardah. Requires completion of Enakhra's Lament.
Tyras Camp 80 squares when chartering to Port Khazard (24 seconds) 1
 Costs between 800-3200 coins per charter.
Underground Pass 635 with shortcut in Underground Pass; 657 otherwise, assuming banking at Prifddinas. 1
 Used in the Underground Pass quest to destroy the orbs of light. While completely impractical for training, with one way taking over 3 minutes, it's a functioning furnace.

Changes[edit | edit source]

Date Changes
8 October 2015
(update)

You can no longer smelt at the side of a Furnace.

Trivia[edit | edit source]

  • The Edgeville furnace previously required the Varrock Diary to use, until 9 April 2015 when it was made accessible to all members. On 15 November 2018, it was made accessible to free players as well.

See also[edit | edit source]

  • Blast Furnace
  • Lovakite furnace
  • Pottery oven
